comments:
RAD 20060929_1957 install (based on 20060927_1623 daily build)
RHEL 4.0 WS

new tptp junit test: select Yes to install 3 jars throws NPE

Create a new java project
Import an archive file (see attachment)
Select File->New->Other >Test > TPTP JUnit Test
Select Next. At the message about adding three jar files to the build path, select Yes. 
 => Then I see the following error in the .log file and the wizard DOES NOT continue. 

Interestingly, if I select No to not add the 3 jar files to the build path, then the wizard will continue, but the jars are not on the build path.

The 3 jars are: 
common.runner.jar
java.runner.jar
junit.jar

[Joe's Comment]

I looked at the code briefly, and my best guess is that the project in question has one or more invalid classpath entries (for which IClasspathEntry.getPath() would return null.)  I can say with certainty that generating a JUnit test in a normal Java project does not throw an NPE.

Two comments:

1) The GA version of the 4.2.1 driver is 200609071820D (http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/downloads/downloads.php).  Where was the 20060927_1623 build downloaded?

2) Can you try the same user scenario with a clean workspace?

I qustion the severity of this defect.  Has the submitter tried the proposed workaround (correcting the errors in the project classpath)?  Can you verify that the workaround corrects the problem and unblocks your testing?  If so, please reduce the severity accordingly.  [I suggest "major"].

Note that the fix has been attached by Julien, and the defect is targeted to 4.3 i3.

This is a RAD install and the 20060929_1957 was downloaded from the CDI site. My build includes TPTP Test version 4.2.2 200609010912 and TPTP Test Tools 4.2.1 version 200607310100. 

I was using a new and clean workspace. 

To clarify, this is a problem in creating the TPTP JUnit Test, not the JUnit Testcase (which I can create without problems). 

In regards to the workaround, I do not see errors on my classpath, so I don't have any that need to be fixed. 

This is still blocking me from completing my testcase.

Jenny, does this work-around help:
- Select No when you are asked to required jars
- When the wizard is completed, manually edit your project classpath:
1) Right-click on your project -> Properties
2) Select Java Build Path
3) Click on the "Libraries" tab
4) Click "Add external JARs..."
5) Go to <eclipse dir>/plugins/org.eclipse.hyades/test.tools.core_v2006xxxxx and select common.runner.jar and java.runner.jar, click "Open"
6) Click "Add Variable..."
7) Select "JUNIT_HOME - ..." and click "Extend"
8) In the tree, select "junit.jar"
9) Close the properties dialog by clicking "OK".
This should fix the classpath and you should be able to complete your test case.

This workaround did not work for me. I allowed Julien Canches to use my machine and here are his comments I received in a note: 

"This morning I have tested the issue on Jenny's machine, and unfortunately there is no work-around.
 
However I could pinpoint the real problem. TPTP makes the wrong assumption that its plugins always reside under ECLIPSE_HOME/plugins/. In Jenny's case, TPTP plugins are under a different directory, which does not match eclipse installation directory (ECLIPSE_HOME). So, although the fix I have included to the bugzilla would allow the user to complete the wizard, this fix is still incomplete as it would not automatically set the classpath."

Created an attachment (id=52410)
Fix for the 4.2.1 release

Here is a fix for the 4.2.1 release. The patch must be applied on top of the official 4.2.1 TPTP release source files.
Not tested with RAD, but succesfully tested on a similar directories layout.

Created an attachment (id=52411)
Fix for 4.3 release

And here is a fix for 4.3 release. This fix will be available in 4.3i3 builds.
Fix delivered in 4.3 stream along with its associated test cases.
The 4.2.1 fix was also committed to the 4.2.1 branch.

(In reply to comment #12)
> The 4.2.1 fix was also committed to the 4.2.1 branch.

I have rolled back the fix from the 4.2.1 branch, until it gets approval by PMC.
Sorry for the confusion.
